issues.description: The problem statement specifies a method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal) but both the template’s Main.java and the solution’s SealSaloon.java define and use a method named computeMealCost(Meal). This naming mismatch will confuse students when implementing and testing the intended functionality.
issues.suggested_fix: Either rename computeMealCost(Meal) in the template and solution to calculateTotalPrice(Meal) or update the problem statement to reference computeMealCost(Meal) so that all artifacts use the same method name.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a method named `calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int`, but both the template and solution code define and use a method called `computeMealCost(Meal)`. Furthermore, the solution’s `Main.java` calls `calculateTotalPrice` even though the `SealSaloon` class only defines `computeMealCost`. This mismatch between `calculateTotalPrice` and `computeMealCost` is likely to confuse students about which method to implement and call.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across all artifacts. For example, rename `computeMealCost` to `calculateTotalPrice` in the `SealSaloon` class and update all calls in template and solution `Main.java` accordingly.
